page.title: 19Welsh news - Bwlch-y-groes.
page.content: Clebran is a local,monthly,Welsh newspaper.It covers a large area of North Pembrokeshire.It costs 20 pence.Clebran is for all the family.It contains sports news,a children's page,a crossword,births deaths and marriages,photographs,cartoons, articles on farming,the Eisteddfod,recipes and gardening,a letters page,clubs and societies, advertisements and all the local gossip.Mrs George,Llainfawr and Mrs Thomas,Hafan Deg are the local reporters.Most people in the area read Clebran.Here is a paragraph from the May edition."On 20 April,Mr&Mrs George Langrage moved from the Falls,Star to live in Aberporth.Best wishes and every happiness to them in their new home.A warm welcome to Mr&Mrs Morgan and their family who have taken over the Falls.We wish them every success".
